com.meltmedia.cadmium.servlets
Class XForwardedSecureRedirectStrategy

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
SecureRedirectStrategy
public class XForwardedSecureRedirectStrategy
extends SimpleSecureRedirectStrategy

A redirect strategy that uses the X-Forwarded-Proto header to determine the protocol that was originally used with the request.

Author:
Christian Trimble

Method Detail

isSecure

public boolean isSecure(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
When the X-Forwarded-Proto header is present, this method returns true if the header equals "https", false otherwise. When the header is not present, it delegates this call to the super class.

Specified by:
isSecure in interface SecureRedirectStrategy
Overrides:
isSecure in class SimpleSecureRedirectStrategy
Parameters:
request - The request to test.
Returns:
true if the original request was made over a secure protocol, false otherwise.

getProtocol

public java.lang.String getProtocol(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
When the X-Forwarded-Proto header is present, this method returns the value of that header. When the header is not present, it delegates this call to the super class.

Overrides:
getProtocol in class SimpleSecureRedirectStrategy
Parameters:
request - the request made by the user.
Returns:
the original protocol for the request.

getPort

public int getPort(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
When the X-Forwarded-Port header is present, this method returns the value of that header. When the header is not present, it delegates this call to the super class.

Overrides:
getPort in class SimpleSecureRedirectStrategy
Parameters:
request - the request made by the user.
Returns:
the original protocol for the request.
